conversation_input.content:
translate this please:
One possible solution to the inability to reread in RSVP would be to incorporate a “go back” button on the device that would repeat the text for the reader, a feature that many apps using RSVP technology, including Spritz, have added. However, many of these buttons merely start the text (or sentence) over from the beginning. One recently announced version of RSVP technology to be released for the Amazon Kindle claims that it will allow readers to use their finger to scan through the text continuously in order to move backward or forward to a particular word. This is an improvement over only being able to start at the beginning of a sentence in that it allows for more flexibility in moving through the text. However, it has not been shown that these methods for regressing (or skipping forward) in RSVP are as effective as the eyes are in conventional reading, in which readers have a spatial representation of the text and a sense of where to move their eyes to clarify something and where to return to continue reading. In order to do this in a truly effective way, the device would need to know how far back in the text to go and would need to repeat the text from that point. Regression behavior in reading is one of the less understood aspects of the process, so even generating a general principle for this would be difficult—not to mention that there is substantial variability both across and within individuals in the sequence with which they reread words (von der Malsburg & Vasishth, 2011).
Another concern about apps using RSVP is that they do not allow for parafoveal preview. As we have discussed, a large body of research using the moving-window paradigm (see Rayner, 2014) and boundary paradigm (see Schotter et al., 2012) has shown that information from more than just the currently fixated word is used. Some information obtained from the next word before it is directly fixated is used to give the reader a head start on processing it; if this preview is denied (e.g., if the word is masked until it is fixated or not presented at all), reading time for the word is longer than if it had been visible. With the single-word RSVP method, readers do not have, and therefore cannot take advantage of, preview information.
An important concern about RSVP-based apps regards the limits that such a technique may pose for comprehension. In the “Rapid Serial Visual Presentation” section above, we described a number of studies that showed similar levels of comprehension for full text reading and RSVP when words were presented at a normal rate. It appears that, at least when comprehension is measured as it was in those studies, the elimination of parafoveal preview and of opportunities for regressive movements to earlier parts of a text do not markedly undermine text understanding when RSVP is used. But two crucial caveats must be emphasized. First, when pauses between sentences were not included in RSVP presentations of text, comprehension clearly suffered (Masson, 1983). Second, speeding text presentation beyond normal reading rates consistently led to reduced levels of comprehension and memory (Juola et al., 1982; Potter et al., 1980). These results indicate that the mental operations responsible for assembling viewed words into meaningful ideas and retaining them in memory cannot be completed if adequate time is not provided. Therefore, the promise that RSVP can produce faster reading without compromising understanding and memory is not supported by the research we reviewed.
As of the writing of this article, we are familiar with only two published studies that directly compared traditional reading to reading with (an approximation of) Spritz (Benedetto et al., 2015; Dingler, Shirazi, Kunze, & Schmidt, 2015). Only one of these studies objectively compared comprehension in RSVP reading and conventional reading (Benedetto et al., 2015). That study involved a passage of text taken from George Orwell’s 1984, and participants were allowed to pause the RSVP stream whenever they wanted. Taking these pauses into account, the average reading speed in the traditional reading condition and that in the RSVP condition were very similar and somewhat slower than normal reading (200 and 209 wpm, respectively). Reading via RSVP increased eye fatigue relative to traditional reading and, although accuracy was equivalent on comprehension questions that required making inferences, it was poorer on comprehension questions that assessed literal comprehension of the text. These data suggest that readers were still able to get the gist of the passage when reading at normal rates via RSVP but that their ability to maintain a veridical representation of the wording of the text was impaired. It is likely that even the gist representation would have been impaired at faster RSVP rates. Additional work needs to be done to evaluate reading using technologies such as Spritz, and this work will need to be presented in peer-reviewed conferences and journals so that it can be evaluated by the scientific community.
Based on the research that has been done on normal reading and RSVP, we suspect that presentation of moderately complex texts via RSVP apps will not allow people to achieve the goal of greatly increasing reading speed (e.g., by doubling or tripling their normal rate) while maintaining good comprehension. The real practical application of RSVP may be for wearable technology like smartwatches and glasses with optical displays that have only enough space to present one or two words at a time. The RSVP method may be the only viable way to display text on these screens. If the message is not too long or complex, RSVP may suffice to get it across.

chosen.answer: "Turn off" or "Disable" in Korean can be expressed by using the following verbs: 끔소로 꺼내 (turn off completely), 끔소로 꺼내요 (turn off completely, polite), 꺼내요 (turn off, polite), or 꺼내 (turn off).

* "uncheck" - 해제하세요 (hae-je-hae-seo-yo)
* "when running on battery power" - 배터리 전원으로 실행할 때 (battery-ui jeon-won-eulo sil-hae-hal-dae)

So, the full sentence in Korean would be: "배터리 수명을 최대화하려면 배터리 전원으로 실행할 때 해제하세요."

conversation_input.content:
translate this please:
One possible solution to the inability to reread in RSVP would be to incorporate a “go back” button on the device that would repeat the text for the reader, a feature that many apps using RSVP technology, including Spritz, have added. However, many of these buttons merely start the text (or sentence) over from the beginning. One recently announced version of RSVP technology to be released for the Amazon Kindle claims that it will allow readers to use their finger to scan through the text continuously in order to move backward or forward to a particular word. This is an improvement over only being able to start at the beginning of a sentence in that it allows for more flexibility in moving through the text. However, it has not been shown that these methods for regressing (or skipping forward) in RSVP are as effective as the eyes are in conventional reading, in which readers have a spatial representation of the text and a sense of where to move their eyes to clarify something and where to return to continue reading. In order to do this in a truly effective way, the device would need to know how far back in the text to go and would need to repeat the text from that point. Regression behavior in reading is one of the less understood aspects of the process, so even generating a general principle for this would be difficult—not to mention that there is substantial variability both across and within individuals in the sequence with which they reread words (von der Malsburg & Vasishth, 2011).
Another concern about apps using RSVP is that they do not allow for parafoveal preview. As we have discussed, a large body of research using the moving-window paradigm (see Rayner, 2014) and boundary paradigm (see Schotter et al., 2012) has shown that information from more than just the currently fixated word is used. Some information obtained from the next word before it is directly fixated is used to give the reader a head start on processing it; if this preview is denied (e.g., if the word is masked until it is fixated or not presented at all), reading time for the word is longer than if it had been visible. With the single-word RSVP method, readers do not have, and therefore cannot take advantage of, preview information.
An important concern about RSVP-based apps regards the limits that such a technique may pose for comprehension. In the “Rapid Serial Visual Presentation” section above, we described a number of studies that showed similar levels of comprehension for full text reading and RSVP when words were presented at a normal rate. It appears that, at least when comprehension is measured as it was in those studies, the elimination of parafoveal preview and of opportunities for regressive movements to earlier parts of a text do not markedly undermine text understanding when RSVP is used. But two crucial caveats must be emphasized. First, when pauses between sentences were not included in RSVP presentations of text, comprehension clearly suffered (Masson, 1983). Second, speeding text presentation beyond normal reading rates consistently led to reduced levels of comprehension and memory (Juola et al., 1982; Potter et al., 1980). These results indicate that the mental operations responsible for assembling viewed words into meaningful ideas and retaining them in memory cannot be completed if adequate time is not provided. Therefore, the promise that RSVP can produce faster reading without compromising understanding and memory is not supported by the research we reviewed.
As of the writing of this article, we are familiar with only two published studies that directly compared traditional reading to reading with (an approximation of) Spritz (Benedetto et al., 2015; Dingler, Shirazi, Kunze, & Schmidt, 2015). Only one of these studies objectively compared comprehension in RSVP reading and conventional reading (Benedetto et al., 2015). That study involved a passage of text taken from George Orwell’s 1984, and participants were allowed to pause the RSVP stream whenever they wanted. Taking these pauses into account, the average reading speed in the traditional reading condition and that in the RSVP condition were very similar and somewhat slower than normal reading (200 and 209 wpm, respectively). Reading via RSVP increased eye fatigue relative to traditional reading and, although accuracy was equivalent on comprehension questions that required making inferences, it was poorer on comprehension questions that assessed literal comprehension of the text. These data suggest that readers were still able to get the gist of the passage when reading at normal rates via RSVP but that their ability to maintain a veridical representation of the wording of the text was impaired. It is likely that even the gist representation would have been impaired at faster RSVP rates. Additional work needs to be done to evaluate reading using technologies such as Spritz, and this work will need to be presented in peer-reviewed conferences and journals so that it can be evaluated by the scientific community.
Based on the research that has been done on normal reading and RSVP, we suspect that presentation of moderately complex texts via RSVP apps will not allow people to achieve the goal of greatly increasing reading speed (e.g., by doubling or tripling their normal rate) while maintaining good comprehension. The real practical application of RSVP may be for wearable technology like smartwatches and glasses with optical displays that have only enough space to present one or two words at a time. The RSVP method may be the only viable way to display text on these screens. If the message is not too long or complex, RSVP may suffice to get it across.

It appears that, at least when comprehension is measured as it was in those studies, the elimination of parafoveal preview and of opportunities for regressive movements to earlier parts of a text do not markedly undermine text understanding when RSVP is used. But two crucial caveats must be emphasized. First, when pauses between sentences were not included in RSVP presentations of text, comprehension clearly suffered (Masson, 1983). Second, speeding text presentation beyond normal reading rates consistently led to reduced levels of comprehension and memory (Juola et al., 1982; Potter et al., 1980). These results indicate that the mental operations responsible for assembling viewed words into meaningful ideas and retaining them in memory cannot be completed if adequate time is not provided. Therefore, the promise that RSVP can produce faster reading without compromising understanding and memory is not supported by the research we reviewed.
As of the writing of this article, we are familiar with only two published studies that directly compared traditional reading to reading with (an approximation of) Spritz (Benedetto et al., 2015; Dingler, Shirazi, Kunze, & Schmidt, 2015). Only one of these studies objectively compared comprehension in RSVP reading and conventional reading (Benedetto et al., 2015). That study involved a passage of text taken from George Orwell’s 1984, and participants were allowed to pause the RSVP stream whenever they wanted. Taking these pauses into account, the average reading speed in the traditional reading condition and that in the RSVP condition were very similar and somewhat slower than normal reading (200 and 209 wpm, respectively). Reading via RSVP increased eye fatigue relative to traditional reading and, although accuracy was equivalent on comprehension questions that required making inferences, it was poorer on comprehension questions that assessed literal comprehension of the text. These data suggest that readers were still able to get the gist of the passage when reading at normal rates via RSVP but that their ability to maintain a veridical representation of the wording of the text was impaired. It is likely that even the gist representation would have been impaired at faster RSVP rates. Additional work needs to be done to evaluate reading using technologies such as Spritz, and this work will need to be presented in peer-reviewed conferences and journals so that it can be evaluated by the scientific community.
Based on the research that has been done on normal reading and RSVP, we suspect that presentation of moderately complex texts via RSVP apps will not allow people to achieve the goal of greatly increasing reading speed (e.g., by doubling or tripling their normal rate) while maintaining good comprehension. The real practical application of RSVP may be for wearable technology like smartwatches and glasses with optical displays that have only enough space to present one or two words at a time. The RSVP method may be the only viable way to display text on these screens. If the message is not too long or complex, RSVP may suffice to get it across.

chosen.answer:
Sure! Here’s the translation of the provided text:

---

Una posible solución a la incapacidad de releer en la presentación visual rápida (RSVP) sería incorporar un botón de "volver atrás" en el dispositivo que repitiera el texto para el lector, una característica que muchas aplicaciones que utilizan la tecnología RSVP, incluyendo Spritz, han añadido. Sin embargo, muchos de estos botones simplemente reinician el texto (o la oración) desde el principio. Una versión recientemente anunciada de la tecnología RSVP que se lanzará para el Amazon Kindle afirma que permitirá a los lectores usar su dedo para escanear continuamente a través del texto con el fin de retroceder o avanzar hacia una palabra en particular. Esto es una mejora respecto a solo poder comenzar desde el principio de una oración, ya que permite más flexibilidad al moverse a través del texto. Sin embargo, no se ha demostrado que estos métodos para retroceder (o avanzar) en RSVP sean tan efectivos como lo son los ojos en la lectura convencional, en la que los lectores tienen una representación espacial del texto y una noción de dónde mover sus ojos para aclarar algo y dónde regresar para continuar leyendo. Para hacer esto de una manera verdaderamente efectiva, el dispositivo necesitaría saber cuán lejos retroceder en el texto y tendría que repetir el texto desde ese punto. El comportamiento de regresión en la lectura es uno de los aspectos menos comprendidos del proceso, por lo que incluso generar un principio general para esto sería difícil, sin mencionar que hay una variabilidad sustancial tanto entre individuos como dentro de ellos en la secuencia con la que releen palabras (von der Malsburg & Vasishth, 2011).

Otra preocupación sobre las aplicaciones que utilizan RSVP es que no permiten la vista parafoveal previa. Como hemos discutido, un gran cuerpo de investigación utilizando el paradigma de ventana móvil (ver Rayner, 2014) y el paradigma de límite (ver Schotter et al., 2012) ha demostrado que se utiliza información de más que solo la palabra actualmente fijada. Se utiliza información obtenida de la siguiente palabra antes de que sea fijada directamente para darle al lector una ventaja en su procesamiento; si esta vista previa se niega (por ejemplo, si la palabra está enmascarada hasta que se fije o no se presenta en absoluto), el tiempo de lectura para la palabra es más largo que si hubiera sido visible. Con el método de RSVP de una sola palabra, los lectores no tienen, y por lo tanto no pueden aprovechar, la información de vista previa.

Una preocupación importante sobre las aplicaciones basadas en RSVP se refiere a los límites que tal técnica puede imponer a la comprensión. En la sección "Presentación Visual Rápida en Serie" anterior, describimos varios estudios que mostraron niveles similares de comprensión para la lectura de texto completo y RSVP cuando las palabras se presentaron a un ritmo normal. Parece que, al menos cuando la comprensión se mide como se hizo en esos estudios, la eliminación de la vista previa parafoveal y de las oportunidades para movimientos regresivos a partes anteriores de un texto no socavan notablemente la comprensión del texto cuando se utiliza RSVP. Pero se deben enfatizar dos advertencias cruciales. Primero, cuando no se incluyeron pausas entre oraciones en las presentaciones de texto RSVP, la comprensión claramente sufrió (Masson, 1983). Segundo, acelerar la presentación del texto más allá de las tasas de lectura normales llevó consistentemente a niveles reducidos de comprensión y memoria (Juola et al., 1982; Potter et al., 1980). Estos resultados indican que las operaciones mentales responsables de ensamblar palabras vistas en ideas significativas y retenerlas en la memoria no pueden completarse si no se proporciona tiempo adecuado. Por lo tanto, la promesa de que RSVP puede producir una lectura más rápida sin comprometer la comprensión y la memoria no está respaldada por la investigación que revisamos.

Hasta la redacción de este artículo, solo conocemos dos estudios publicados que compararon directamente la lectura tradicional con la lectura con (una aproximación de) Spritz (Benedetto et al., 2015; Dingler, Shirazi, Kunze, & Schmidt, 2015). Solo uno de estos estudios comparó objetivamente la comprensión en la lectura RSVP y la lectura convencional (Benedetto et al., 2015). Ese estudio involucró un pasaje de texto tomado de 1984 de George Orwell, y se permitió a los participantes pausar el flujo de RSVP siempre que quisieran. Teniendo en cuenta estas pausas, la velocidad promedio de lectura en la condición de lectura tradicional y en la condición de RSVP fueron muy similares y algo más lentas que la lectura normal (200 y 209 palabras por minuto, respectivamente). Leer a través de RSVP aumentó la fatiga ocular en relación con la lectura tradicional y, aunque la precisión fue equivalente en preguntas de comprensión que requerían hacer inferencias, fue inferior en preguntas de comprensión que evaluaban la comprensión literal del texto. Estos datos sugieren que los lectores aún podían captar la esencia del pasaje al leer a tasas normales a través de RSVP, pero que su capacidad para mantener una representación verídica de la redacción del texto estaba afectada. Es probable que incluso la representación de la esencia se hubiera visto afectada a tasas más rápidas de RSVP. Se necesita hacer más trabajo para evaluar la lectura utilizando tecnologías como Spritz, y este trabajo deberá presentarse en conferencias y revistas revisadas por pares para que pueda ser evaluado por la comunidad científica.

Basado en la investigación que se ha realizado sobre la lectura normal y RSVP, sospechamos que la presentación de textos moderadamente complejos a través de aplicaciones RSVP no permitirá a las personas alcanzar el objetivo de aumentar considerablemente la velocidad de lectura (por ejemplo, duplicando o triplicando su tasa normal) mientras mantienen una buena comprensión. La verdadera aplicación práctica de RSVP puede ser para tecnología portátil como relojes inteligentes y gafas con pantallas ópticas que solo tienen suficiente espacio para presentar una o dos palabras a la vez. El método RSVP puede ser la única forma viable de mostrar texto en estas pantallas. Si el mensaje no es demasiado largo o complejo, RSVP puede ser suficiente para transmitirlo.

---

Here's a breakdown of the sentence:

* "배터리 전원으로 작동 중이면" - This means "when running on battery power."

* "배터리 수명을 극대화할 수 있습니다." - This means "you can maximize battery life."

So, the full sentence is suggesting that you can conserve battery power on your device by disabling certain features or settings when running on battery power.

translate this to persian please:
The I² statistic is a measure that quantifies the amount of heterogeneity, or variability, across different studies in a meta-analysis. It is used to determine the extent to which the differences observed between studies are due to true differences in the effect being studied, rather than random chance.

Heterogeneity refers to the variability or diversity among the results of different studies included in a meta-analysis. It can arise from various factors such as differences in study design, population characteristics, interventions, or outcome measures. Heterogeneity is an important consideration in meta-analysis because it can affect the overall estimate of the effect size and the interpretation of the results.

Chance, in this context, refers to the random variation that can occur in the results of individual studies due to sampling error or other random factors. It is important to distinguish between the variation that is due to chance and the variation that is due to true differences between studies.

The I² statistic is expressed as a percentage and ranges from 0% to 100%. It represents the proportion of the total variation in effect sizes across studies that is due to heterogeneity rather than chance. A higher value of I² indicates a greater degree of heterogeneity among the studies.

For example, if the I² statistic is 0%, it means that there is no heterogeneity among the studies, and all the observed variation in effect sizes can be attributed to chance alone. On the other hand, if the I² statistic is 100%, it means that all the observed variation in effect sizes is due to heterogeneity, and there is no contribution from chance.

The I² statistic is commonly used in meta-analysis to assess the degree of heterogeneity and to guide the interpretation of the results. It helps researchers determine whether it is appropriate to combine the results of different studies and calculate an overall effect size, or if the heterogeneity is too high and the studies should be analyzed separately.

Heterogeneity به متفاوتی یا تنوع امروزه مطرح شده در متا-آنالیز بین درون درستها می‌پردازد. آن می‌تواند از عوامل مختلفی مانند تفاوت های طرح گردشگری، ویژگی‌های Population یا ایجاد خدمات و ر Islamic نتایج پیدا کند. آی شمارنده (I²) درصد است و بین 0% تا 100% قرار می‌گیرد. آن نشان می‌دهد تناسب کل تغییرات اثرهای اندازه‌گیری در درون درستها که به عنوان هتروگنیتی به دنبال شخصیت می‌آید بدلیل تصادف. ارزش بالای I² به معنای درجه بالای هتروگنیتی در میان درون درستها است.

به عنوان مثال، اگر I² statistic 0% است، به معنای این است که هیچ هتروگنیتی وجود ندارد درمیان درستها و همه تغییراتی در اندازه‌گیری اثرها می‌تواند به تصادف اختصاص داده شود. مرتبه دیگر، اگر statistic ist 100% به معنای این است که همه تغییرات در اندازه‌گیری اثرها به هتروگنیتی به درستی بدلیل وجود ندارد و هیچ ثروت از تصادف.

conversation_input.content:
translate this to persian please:
The I² statistic is a measure that quantifies the amount of heterogeneity, or variability, across different studies in a meta-analysis. It is used to determine the extent to which the differences observed between studies are due to true differences in the effect being studied, rather than random chance.

Heterogeneity refers to the variability or diversity among the results of different studies included in a meta-analysis. It can arise from various factors such as differences in study design, population characteristics, interventions, or outcome measures. Heterogeneity is an important consideration in meta-analysis because it can affect the overall estimate of the effect size and the interpretation of the results.

Chance, in this context, refers to the random variation that can occur in the results of individual studies due to sampling error or other random factors. It is important to distinguish between the variation that is due to chance and the variation that is due to true differences between studies.

The I² statistic is expressed as a percentage and ranges from 0% to 100%. It represents the proportion of the total variation in effect sizes across studies that is due to heterogeneity rather than chance. A higher value of I² indicates a greater degree of heterogeneity among the studies.

For example, if the I² statistic is 0%, it means that there is no heterogeneity among the studies, and all the observed variation in effect sizes can be attributed to chance alone. On the other hand, if the I² statistic is 100%, it means that all the observed variation in effect sizes is due to heterogeneity, and there is no contribution from chance.

The I² statistic is commonly used in meta-analysis to assess the degree of heterogeneity and to guide the interpretation of the results. It helps researchers determine whether it is appropriate to combine the results of different studies and calculate an overall effect size, or if the heterogeneity is too high and the studies should be analyzed separately.

به عنوان مثال، اگر آمار I² 0٪ باشد، به این معنی است که هیچ ناهمگونی در بین مطالعات وجود ندارد و تمام تغییرات مشاهده شده در اندازه اثر را می‌توان تنها به تصادف نسبت داد. از سوی دیگر، اگر آمار I² 100٪ باشد، به این معنی است که تمام تغییرات مشاهده شده در اندازه اثر به دلیل ناهمگونی است و هیچ سهمی از تصادف وجود ندارد.

آمار I² معمولاً در متاآنالیز برای ارزیابی درجه ناهمگونی و هدایت تفسیر نتایج استفاده می‌شود. به محققان کمک می‌کند تا تعیین کنند که آیا ترکیب نتایج مطالعات مختلف و محاسبه اندازه اثر کلی مناسب است یا خیر، یا اینکه ناهمگونی بسیار زیاد است و مطالعات باید جداگانه تجزیه و تحلیل شوند.

conversation_input.content:
translate this to persian:
Subjects read aloud 200-word passages of statistical approximations up to the 8th order. Their eye-movements were recorded together with a trace of the speech output. Speed of reading, using the syllable as the unit of measurement, increased up to the 5th order for slow readers. Fast readers, on the other hand, further increased their speed to the 6th order. This result had been predicted from a hypothesis that fast readers use contextual cues more efficiently.
Measures of the material in the eye-voice span showed an increase up to the 8th order. Fast readers had a larger material span than slow readers beyond the 5th order, a result paralleling the differences in speed increase. It is suggested that the eye-voice span measured in time is dependent upon the chosen reading speed and the material span.
From the eye-movement records there was no variation of the mean duration of fixation between passages, or between fast and slow readers. The average value was about 240 millisec. The number of both forward and regressive eye movements decreased with increase in contextual constraint up to the 5th or 6th order, i.e. with increase in speed of reading. Fast readers were superior to slow readers in both these respects. The effect of decreasing contextual constraint was to produce more regressive movements together with a slightly smaller mean saccade.

translate this to persian:
Subjects read aloud 200-word passages of statistical approximations up to the 8th order. Their eye-movements were recorded together with a trace of the speech output. Speed of reading, using the syllable as the unit of measurement, increased up to the 5th order for slow readers. Fast readers, on the other hand, further increased their speed to the 6th order. This result had been predicted from a hypothesis that fast readers use contextual cues more efficiently.
Measures of the material in the eye-voice span showed an increase up to the 8th order. Fast readers had a larger material span than slow readers beyond the 5th order, a result paralleling the differences in speed increase. It is suggested that the eye-voice span measured in time is dependent upon the chosen reading speed and the material span.
From the eye-movement records there was no variation of the mean duration of fixation between passages, or between fast and slow readers. The average value was about 240 millisec. The number of both forward and regressive eye movements decreased with increase in contextual constraint up to the 5th or 6th order, i.e. with increase in speed of reading. Fast readers were superior to slow readers in both these respects. The effect of decreasing contextual constraint was to produce more regressive movements together with a slightly smaller mean saccade.

Subjects با کتاب خوانی متن 200 واژه از قریب به مرحله 8 وار می‌خواندند. استراحات چشم و پیغمبر و نوشته با هم به پایان رسید. سرعت خوانی بر اساس واژه از 5 مرحله برای خوانندگان wolves به افزایش یافت. خوانندگان سریع در مرحله 6 نیز سرعت خوانی را به افزایش بردند. این نتیجه از یک فرضیه است که خوانندگان سریع از پیش و پس واژه های مورد نیاز به برنامه ریزی بهتر استفاده می‌کنند.
تعیینات مواد در استراحات چشم و پیغمبر نشان داد که سرعت خوانی را تا 8 مرحله افزایش یافت. خوانندگان سریع تا 5 مرحله برابر سرعت خوانی داشتند. از این مرحله و به بعد، خوانندگان سریع تا 6 مرحله نیز سرعت خوانی را به افزایش بردند. این نتیجه از یک فرضیه است که سرعت خوانی در زمان انتخابی است و مواد شناسان است.
از سوی چشم و پیغمبر و نوشته نشان داد که میان دو گروه خواننده و بین مرحله های خوانی در مورد مدت میانگین تعادل نبود. مقدار میانگین مرحله برابر 240 میلی ثانیه بود. تعداد حرکات چشم انتقالی و عكسی در مرحله 5 و 6 از افزایش یافت. خوانندگان سریع بیشتر از خوانندگان wolves برای این را استفاده می‌کنند. این اثر از افزایش واژه انتظار و پیش و پس واژه های مورد نیاز به برنامه ریزی برا است.

Whether a State is attempting to prevent organized crime activities, financial and
economic crime, corruption or terrorism, the establishment of better legal bases for
international cooperation is a prerequisite1. Strengthening the convergence of criminal law
and criminal law procedure is part of any long-term strategy to build more effective
international cooperation. Developing stronger bilateral and multi-lateral agreements on
mutual legal assistance is also part of the solution. The universal conventions against
terrorism, as well as the United Nations Conventions against Transnational Organized
Crime and against Corruption provide a strong basis for legal cooperation and often suggest
some of the elements that must be developed as part of a national capacity for effective
investigation and prosecution of these crimes. Having national legislation in place to fully
implement these instruments is therefore of paramount importance2, as is the adoption of
the administrative measures necessary to build strong prosecution services and support the
various modalities of both domestic coordination and international cooperation. ترجم للعربي

سواء كانت الدولة تحاول منع أنشطة الجريمة المنظمة، أو الجريمة المالية والاقتصادية، أو الفساد، أو الإرهاب، فإن إقامة أسس قانونية أفضل للتعاون الدولي هو شرط أساسي. يعتبر تعزيز التقارب بين القانون الجنائي وإجراءات القانون الجنائي جزءًا من أي استراتيجية طويلة الأمد لبناء تعاون دولي أكثر فعالية. كذلك، يشكل تطوير اتفاقيات ثنائية ومتعددة الأطراف أقوى حول المساعدة القانونية المتبادلة جزءاً من الحل. توفر الاتفاقيات العالمية ضد الإرهاب، فضلاً عن الاتفاقيات الأممية ضد الجريمة المنظمة عبر الوطنية وضد الفساد، أساساً قوياً للتعاون القانوني وغالباً ما تقترح بعض العناصر التي يجب تطويرها كجزء من القدرة الوطنية للتحقيق الفعال ومقاضاة هذه الجرائم. لذا، فإن وجود تشريعات وطنية لتنفيذ هذه الأدوات بشكل كامل يعتبر ذا أهمية قصوى، كما هو الحال بالنسبة لاعتماد التدابير الإدارية اللازمة لبناء خدمات ادعاء قوية ودعم مختلف صيغ التنسيق المحلية والتعاون الدولي.

By comparison with the prevention of terrorism, the prevention of acts of organized
crime might be thought easier to conceptualize precisely and less controversial to legislate
against and police. This impression is correct up to a point, because it is possible to
arrive at some general characteristics of organized crime, and because legislation against it
is not currently subject to heated public controversy based on probable violations of civil
or political rights, as in the case of terrorism. But there is a significant residue of legal,
moral and political difficulty: legislation against organized crime is hard to make effective; the harm of organized crime is not uniform, and so some preventive legislation
seems too sweeping and potentially unjust. More fundamentally, the scale and rewards of
organized crime are often dependent on mass public participation in markets for proscribed goods, which may point to a hidden public consensus in favour of some of what
is criminalized. Preventive policing and legislation in both areas, then, are less easily
justified than first appears ترجملي ده للعربي

chosen.answer: The prevention of organized crime may seem easier to address than the prevention of terrorism, as it can be defined and legislated against with less controversy. However, there are still significant legal, moral, and political challenges to making effective legislation against organized crime. One issue is that the harm caused by organized crime is not uniform, leading to concerns that preventive measures may be overly broad and unjust. Additionally, the scale and profits of organized crime are often dependent on public demand for illegal goods and services, which can make it difficult to justify preventive policing and legislation. Ultimately, both areas require a nuanced approach that balances public safety with individual rights and freedoms.
